Package clientSide.control

Class ReportsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • clientSide.control.ReportsController
  • public class ReportsController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class for managing report generation and data retrieval for park visitation statistics. This class provides functionality to check for data availability, generate various reports, and save report data.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static ReportsController instance  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      private ReportsController()
      An empty and private controller, for the singleton design pattern

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ReportsController getInstance()
        The ReportsController is defined as a Singleton class. This method allows creating an instance of the class only once during runtime of the application.
        Returns:
        the ReportsController instance

      • isReportDataAvailable

        public boolean isReportDataAvailable​(java.lang.String selectedMonth,
                                     java.lang.String selectedYear,
                                     Park selectedPark,
                                     java.lang.String reportType)
        Checks if report data is available for a specific park, month, and year.
        Parameters:
        selectedMonth - The month for which the report is to be generated.
        selectedYear - The year for which the report is to be generated.
        selectedPark - The Park object for which the report is to be generated.
        reportType - A String representing the type of report to check data availability for. This parameter allows the method to be flexible and used for different types of reports.
        Returns:
        boolean True if data is available for the specified parameters, False otherwise. This allows calling methods to conditionally proceed with report generation or to inform the user about the lack of data.

      • isParkManagerReportAvailable

        public boolean isParkManagerReportAvailable​(java.lang.String selectedMonth,
                                            java.lang.String selectedYear,
                                            Park park,
                                            java.lang.String reportType)
        Checks if a specific report from the park manager to the department manager is available in the report tables for a given month, year, and park.
        Parameters:
        selectedMonth - The month for which the report's availability is to be checked.
        selectedYear - The year for which the report's availability is to be checked.
        park - The Park object for which the report's availability is to be checked.
        reportType - The type of the report to check for ("total_visitors" or "usage").
        Returns:
        true if the report is available, false otherwise.

      • generateUsageReport

        public java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<java.time.LocalDate,​java.lang.Integer>> generateUsageReport​(java.lang.String selectedMonth,
                                                                                                         java.lang.String selectedYear,
                                                                                                         Park park)
        Generates a usage report for a specific park over a given month and year. The report includes the daily visitor count within the specified time frame. This method constructs a SELECT query to fetch the total number of visitors for each day of visit within the selected month and year for the specified park.
        Parameters:
        selectedMonth - The month for which the report is to be generated
        selectedYear - The year for which the report is to be generated
        park - The Park object for which the report is to be generated. This object must not be null and should contain valid park information.
        Returns:
        A list of objects, where each pair consists of a representing a day within the specified month and year, and an Integer representing the total number of visitors for that day.

      • saveUsageReport

        public boolean saveUsageReport​(java.lang.String selectedMonth,
                               java.lang.String selectedYear,
                               Park park)
        Attempts to save a usage report for a given park, month, and year in the database. It first checks if a report for the specified park and date range already exists to avoid duplicate entries. If no such report exists, it proceeds to insert a new record with the given park name and date into the 'usage_report' table.
        Parameters:
        selectedMonth - The month for which the report is being saved.
        selectedYear - The year for which the report is being saved.
        park - The Park object representing the park for which the report is being saved.
        Returns:
        true if the insert operation is successful, false if the report already exists or if an error occurs during the operation.

      • processFetchedData

        public java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<java.time.LocalDate,​java.lang.Integer>> processFetchedData​(java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> resultList)
        Processes data fetched from the database to aggregate visitor counts by date. This method takes a list of data entries, where each entry consists of a date and a corresponding number of visitors for that date. It then aggregates the visitor counts for each date and sorts the aggregated data chronologically.
        Parameters:
        resultList - A list of entries, where each Object array is expected to contain two elements: the first element (index 0) is representing the day of the visit, and the second element (index 1) is representing the number of visitors on that day.
        Returns:
        A sorted list of objects, each representing a unique date and the aggregated number of visitors for that date. Each Pair consists the key (representing the day of visit) and the value (representing the total number of visitors for that day).

      • generateTotalNumberOfVisitorsReport

        public javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> generateTotalNumberOfVisitorsReport​(java.lang.String selectedMonth,
                                                                                                       java.lang.String selectedYear,
                                                                                                       Park park)
        Generates a report of the total number of visitors for a specific park, by visitor type, over a given month and year. This method constructs a SELECT query to fetch counts of visitors based on their visit type ('individual' or 'group') within the selected time frame for the specified park.
        Parameters:
        selectedMonth - The month for which the report is to be generated.
        selectedYear - The year for which the report is to be generated.
        park - The Park object for which the report is to be generated. This object must not be null and should contain valid park information to identify the park in the database.
        Returns:
        A Pair where the key is the total number of individual visitors and the value is the total number of group visitors for the specified park, month, and year. Returns a pair of zeros if no visitors are found for the given criteria.

      • saveTotalNumberOfVisitorsReport

        public boolean saveTotalNumberOfVisitorsReport​(java.lang.String selectedMonth,
                                               java.lang.String selectedYear,
                                               Park park)
        Attempts to save a total number of visitors report for a given park, month, and year in the database. It first checks if a report for the specified park and date range already exists to avoid duplicate entries. If no such report exists, it proceeds to insert a new record with the given park name and date into the 'total_number_of_visitors_report' table.
        Parameters:
        selectedMonth - The month for which the report is being saved.
        selectedYear - The year for which the report is being saved.
        park - The Park object representing the park for which the report is being saved.
        Returns:
        true if the insert operation is successful, false if the report already exists or if an error occurs during the operation.

      • generateVisitReport

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Data<java.lang.Number,​java.lang.Number>>> generateVisitReport​(java.lang.String selectedMonth,
                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String selectedYear,
                                                                                                                                                          Park selectedPark)
        Generates a report for park visits within a specified month and year for a given park. This report differentiates visits by type (e.g., group or individual) and calculates the visit duration.
        Parameters:
        selectedMonth - The month for which the report is being generated.
        selectedYear - The year for which the report is being generated.
        selectedPark - The park for which the report is being generated.
        Returns:
        A map with visit types as keys (e.g., "Group", "Individual Visitor") and lists of XYChart.Data objects as values. Each XYChart.Data object represents a visit's entry time and duration.

      • processFetchedDataForChart

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Data<java.lang.Number,​java.lang.Number>>> processFetchedDataForChart​(java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> resultList)
        Processes fetched data for chart visualization. It calculates the duration of each visit based on entry and exit times and categorizes them by visit type.
        Parameters:
        resultList - The list of objects arrays fetched from the database, where each array contains information about a single visit.
        Returns:
        A map with keys as visit types and values as lists of XYChart.Data, each representing a point in the chart for a specific visit type and duration.

      • generateCancellationReport

        public javafx.util.Pair<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Data<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Number>>>,​javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> generateCancellationReport​(java.lang.String selectedMonth,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String selectedYear,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.Object fetchFrom)
        Generates a report detailing the reasons for booking cancellations within a specific month and year for a given park. This report includes average numbers of visitors who either cancelled their booking or did not show up.
        Parameters:
        selectedMonth - The month for which the report is being generated.
        selectedYear - The year for which the report is being generated.
        selectedPark - The park for which the report is being generated.
        Returns:
        A map with keys representing cancellation reasons and values as lists of XYChart.Data objects. Each XYChart.Data object pairs a day of the week with the average number of cancellations for that reason.

      • processFetchedCancellationDataForChart

        private javafx.util.Pair<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Data<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Number>>>,​javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> processFetchedCancellationDataForChart​(java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> resultList)
        Processes fetched data to prepare it for visualization in a chart by calculating the average number of visitors for each cancellation reason and organizing the data by days of the week. Additionally, this method calculates the median number of cancelled orders and no-show visitors across all days, which can provide insights into typical cancellation volumes.
        Parameters:
        resultList - A list of object arrays, each array representing a row from the database query result. Each array is expected to contain data for the day of visit , cancellation reason and number of visitors.
        Returns:
        A pair consisting of a map and another pair. The map's keys are cancellation reasons, and its values are lists of XYChart.Data objects, each representing the average number of cancellations for a day of the week. The nested pair contains the median values for cancelled orders and no-show visitors, respectively.
